identified-content.person: JONKER, BRONWYN ANNE LANGHORNE (BRONWYN ANNE LANGHORNE PROHASKA)

block.p: Bronwyn Anne Langhorne Jonker, the daughter of Mary and A. Daniel Jonker of Roxbury, Conn., was married yesterday to Matthew Thomas Prohaska, the son of Donna and Thomas M. Prohaska of Amherst, N.Y. The Rev. Dr. Robert P. Clements officiated at Christ Episcopal Church in Roxbury, with the Rev. Dr. Florence W. Pert, a minister of the Reformed Church of America, taking part.

Mrs. Prohaska, 37, is the associate managing editor of Elle Decor in New York. She graduated from Kenyon College and studied Italian, textile design and art history in Siena and Florence, Italy, at the American Institute for Foreign Study. Her father retired as the chairman of Boyd, Weir & Sewell, a ship agent and broker in New York.

Bronwyn Anne Langhorne Jonker, the daughter of Mary and A. Daniel Jonker of Roxbury, Conn., was married yesterday to Matthew Thomas Prohaska, the son of Donna and Thomas M. Prohaska of Amherst, N.Y. The Rev. Dr. Robert P. Clements officiated at Christ Episcopal Church in Roxbury, with the Rev. Dr. Florence W. Pert, a minister of the Reformed Church of America, taking part.

Mrs. Prohaska, 37, is the associate managing editor of Elle Decor in New York. She graduated from Kenyon College and studied Italian, textile design and art history in Siena and Florence, Italy, at the American Institute for Foreign Study. Her father retired as the chairman of Boyd, Weir & Sewell, a ship agent and broker in New York.

Mr. Prohaska, 28, is a regional sales director for the Internet Appliance Network, a New York marketing and advertising company for Internet access devices. He graduated magna cum laude from Syracuse University. His mother, who is retired, was a professional soprano and a voice instructor in Jamestown, N.Y. His father is a district sales representative in North Tonawanda, N.Y., for the Lutheran Brotherhood, an insurance provider and financial investment business.
